outreach.subject: Quick sanity check: 2–4 week decision‑support prototype for Linear
outreach.draft_v1: I don’t have website excerpts or product details for Linear in the materials you shared, and the primary users aren’t specified. Given that, a low‑risk way to test decision support is a 2–3 week operational prioritization prototype. We’d ingest a small set of existing inputs (backlog, usage metrics, incident logs) in read‑only mode, run simple trade‑off models, and deliver a lightweight UI plus an exportable prioritized list with estimated impact and confidence bands. No production changes required; handoff includes docs and a runbook. If that approach sounds useful, a 15‑minute sanity check call is enough to confirm scope and sample data.
outreach.draft_v2: The brief doesn’t include Linear’s core product or target users, so I’ll keep this light. A 2‑week roadmap tradeoff simulator is a low‑risk way to validate decision support: we’d ingest a handful of backlog items and basic usage/cost signals (read‑only), run scenario simulations, and deliver an interactive spreadsheet and one‑page memo showing prioritized features with simple sensitivity analysis. No changes to production systems; deliverables include step‑by‑step rerun instructions. If this aligns with your needs, can we do a 15‑minute sanity check call to confirm available data and the right stakeholders?
personalization_points: If Linear recently announced a product, funding round, or growth milestone, mention that and the relevant team.
Share a short sample (CSV or API snippet) of backlog, usage, or incident data to scope effort.
Identify who on product/ops would join a 15‑minute call (Head of Product, Head of Ops, or CEO).
assumptions_or_unknowns: No website excerpts or product details were provided.
Primary users, core use cases, and target outcomes for Linear are unknown.
